metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1301 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted request could have crashed the Apache HTTP Server prior to version 2.4.30, due to an out of bound access after a size limit is reached by reading the HTTP header. This vulnerability is considered very hard if not impossible to trigger in non-debug mode (both log and build level), so it is classified as low risk for common server usage.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.1').
